item.content: New York, Dec 24 (IANS) Facebook has removed the 'Nearby Friends' feature,<p><br>letting your friends see your precise location and instead allowed 'Wave' to broadcast your proximity to them.<br><br>TechCrunch in a report on Saturday said that it had noticed the map being removed from the 'Nearby Friends' service on Facebook app's 'More' tab.<br><br>Facebook has also confirmed that the feature allowing people see your precise location for limited period on a map was no longer available. <br><br>"That strips 'Nearby Friends' main visual component, too, making it now just a list of people's proximities and neighborhood," the report added.<br><br>Facebook has also introduced 'Poke' successor 'Wave' that addresses the core flaw of 'Nearby Friends' that "just because someone is in your proximity, does not mean they are available".<br><br>With 'Wave', users have the option to send a wave to friends they see in Facebook 'Nearby' to let them know they are interested in what that friend is up to. <br><br>"We are testing a new feature within 'Nearby Friends' allowing people to send their friends a waving hand emoji to say "hello" and help them meet up. <br><br>This is meant to give people more ways to express themselves, and help friends interact with one another in new fun and light ways, the report quoted a Facebook spokesperson saying.<br><br>--IANS<br>qd/in/vm</p>

item.title: Piers Sellers: Climate scientist, Nasa astronaut dies at 61
item.description: London, Dec 24 (IANS) British-born astronaut Piers Sellers has died of pancreatic cancer, aged 61, Nasa has said.
item.content: London, Dec 24 (IANS) British-born astronaut Piers Sellers has died of pancreatic cancer, aged 61, Nasa has said.<p><br><br>Sellers, a climate scientist and former astronaut gained fame late in life for his eloquent commentary about the earth's fragility.<br><br>The British-born space scientist, who flew on three space shuttle missions between 2002 and 2010, died on Friday in Houston, Texas, the BBC reported.<br><br>Sellers shared his astronaut's perspective on climate change in Leonardo DiCaprio's documentary, Before the Flood, released earlier this year. <br><br>He told DiCaprio that seeing the earth's atmosphere as a "tiny little onion skin" from space helped him gain a fuller understanding of the planet's delicacy.<br><br>He also wrote a New York Times op-ed about grappling with the meaning of his life's work after learning he had terminal cancer, the Guardian said in its report. <br><br>In both the film and the op-ed, he was optimistic, arguing that he expected human ingenuity to rescue the planet from a dire future of runaway global warming.<br><br>Nasa Administrator Charles Bolden described Sellers as "a tremendous public servant who was dedicated to Nasa, the nation and the world".<br><br>Born in Crowborough, East Sussex, Sellers began working for the US space agency as a scientist in 1982 before joining its astronaut corps in 1996.<br><br>Nasa said Sellers was diagnosed with stage four pancreatic cancer in 2015.<br><br>He became a naturalised US citizen in 1991, making him eligible for the space programme.<br><br>--IANS<br>in/</p>

item.title: Arctic heatwave could break records this Christmas
item.description: London, Dec 24 (IANS) Temperatures at the North Pole could be up to 20 degrees higher than average this Christmas Eve, in what scientists say is a record-breaking heatwave, a media report said on Saturday.
item.content: London, Dec 24 (IANS) Temperatures at the North Pole could be up to 20 degrees higher than average this Christmas Eve, in what scientists say is a record-breaking heatwave, a media report said on Saturday.<p><br><br>Friederike Otto, a senior researcher at Oxford's Environmental Change Institute told BBC News that in pre-industrial times "a heatwave like this would have been extremely rare - we would expect it to occur about every 1,000 years".<br><br>Temperatures are forecast to peak on Christmas Eve around the North Pole - at near-freezing.<br><br>The warm air from the North Atlantic is forecast to flow all the way to the North Pole via Spitsbergen, giving rise to clouds that prevent heat from escaping.<br><br>Otto told the BBC News, the reduction in sea ice is contributing to this "feedback loop".<br><br>Forecasting models show that there is about a 2% chance of a heatwave event occurring every year.<br><br>Thorsten Markus, chief of NASA's Cryospheric Sciences Laboratory, said the heatwave was "very, very unusual".<br><br>--IANS<br>ksk</p>

item.title: India's first 2G ethanol bio-refinery to be set up in Punjab
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) The foundation stone for India's first second generation ethanol bio-refinery to be set up by Hindustan Petroleum Corp (HPCL) at Bathinda in Punjab at a cost of Rs 600 crore will be laid on December 25, an official said on Friday.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) The foundation stone for India's first second generation ethanol bio-refinery to be set up by Hindustan Petroleum Corp (HPCL) at Bathinda in Punjab at a cost of Rs 600 crore will be laid on December 25, an official said on Friday.<p><br><br>The foundation stone laying ceremony will be held at village Tarkhanwala, in Bathinda district of Punjab, a Petroleum Ministry release here said. <br><br>"The Government is encouraging production of second generation ethanol from agricultural residues to provide additional sources of remuneration to farmers, address the growing environmental concerns and support the Ethanol Blended Petrol (EBP) programme," it said.<br><br>The Bathinda bio-refinery will produce 100 kilolitres of ethanol per day, or 3.20 crore litres per annum, which may be sufficient to meet the 26 per cent of the ethanol blending requirement of Punjab, it added. <br><br>According to the Ministry, the proposed bio-refinery will generate employment for about 1,200-1,300 persons in the biomass supply chain and generate an additional income of approximately Rs 20 crore per annum for farmers through purchase of their agriculture residues like sugarcane.<br><br>"The project shall also help in reducing CO2 emissions from the paddy straw which currently is being burnt after harvesting," it said.<br><br>The bio-refinery will also produce about 30,000 tonnes of bio-fertiliser per annum that can be used as soil nutrient. <br><br>It will also produce more than 1 lakh kilograms of Bio-CNG per annum which can cater to transport and clean cooking requirements. <br><br>HPCL and other state-run oil firms are setting up 12 2G ethanol bio-refineries across 11 states at an estimated cost of Rs 10,000 crore, the statement said. <br><br>"These Bio-refineries shall produce around 35- 40 crore litres of ethanol annually, thus contributing significantly towards the EBP programme," it added. <br><br>--IANS<br>bc/dg <br></p>

item.title: Need attention on theoretical physics in India: Indian-American scientist
item.description: Kolkata, Dec 23 (IANS) India needs focused attention to further the discipline of theoretical physics, where it is yet to match global standards, says Indian-American physicist Mani Bhaumik.
item.content: Kolkata, Dec 23 (IANS) India needs focused attention to further the discipline of theoretical physics, where it is yet to match global standards, says Indian-American physicist Mani Bhaumik.<p><br><br>"In the world standard, we are still behind. There are good people like Ashoke Sen (the string theorist) and good work is going on at Jadavpur University, TIFR and others. We are a developing country and we require more resources but we need to have the focus and desire to do well in the field," Bhaumik told IANS here on the sidelines of a felicitation ceremony by the Ophthalmological Society of West Bengal and Disha Eye Hospitals.<br><br>One of the advantages that India has is that the researchers here have traditionally been contemplative and intuitive which is important for the growth of theoretical physics, he said.<br><br>Bhaumik recently funded the establishment of the $11 million Mani L. Bhaumik Institute for Theoretical Physics at University of California, Los Angeles.<br><br>About this, he said the goal is to show the unification of all particles.<br><br>Faculty, postdoctoral researchers and graduate students at the Bhaumik Institute will address unanswered questions in all areas of theoretical physics. <br><br>Theoretical physicists attempt to determine the action of the laws of nature by constructing mathematical models of physical systems and solving the equations that underlie those models, sometimes aided by computers.<br><br>Born in a remote village in West Bengal, Bhaumik rose from poverty to become an eminent scientist who played a key role in developing the laser technology that paved the way for Lasik eye surgery.<br><br>--IANS<br>sgh/ssp/vd<br><br><br><br><br></p>

item.title: Karbonn launches four new 4G variant smartphones
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Domestic smartphone maker Karbonn Mobiles on Friday launched four new 4G enabled smartphones at affordable prices.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Domestic smartphone maker Karbonn Mobiles on Friday launched four new 4G enabled smartphones at affordable prices.<p><br><br>The newly launched devices "Karbonn Aura Note 4G" and "K9 Viraat 4G" with 5.5-inches HD display are priced at Rs 6,490 and Rs 5,790 respectively.<br><br>"Karbonn Aura Note 4G" and "K9 Viraat 4G" are powered by 1.25 GHz Quad Core Processor that runs on a Mediatek MT6737 chipset and sports 5 MP front and an 8 MP rear camera.<br><br>The other two smartphones, "K9 Smart 4G" and "Karbonn Titanium Vista 4G" with 5-inches display are priced at Rs 5,090 and Rs 5,790 respectively.<br><br>"K9 Smart 4G" runs on a 1.2 GHz Quad-Core Mediatek processor along with Mali-T720 GPU and 1GB of RAM. On the camera front, it has 5 MP camera on both the rear and front. <br><br>"Karbonn Titanium Vista 4G" comes packed with an internal memory of 8GB ROM and 1GB RAM. It also offers with 8 MP rear camera and 5 MP front camera.<br><br>With the aim to connect the next billion customers under the smartphone telephony, the range aims to simplify the 4G experience of the user to facilitate easy adoption, the company said in a statement.<br><br>The smartphones are available on both online and offline stores.<br><br>--IANS<br>vc/sm/vt</p>

item.title: Hike to roll out \'Video Stories\' feature
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Home grown messaging app Hike Messenger is set to roll out a \"Video Stories\" feature on Saturday which will allow users to share videos of up to 20 seconds.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Home grown messaging app Hike Messenger is set to roll out a \"Video Stories\" feature on Saturday which will allow users to share videos of up to 20 seconds.<p><br><br>These videos can be further made dramatic using \"Live Filters\". Like the \"Photo Stories\" feature, the \"Video Stories\" also disappear after 48 hours. To post \"Video Stories\" on Hike, users need to enter the stories tab on Hike on the left and long-press on the camera icon on the top right of the screen. Hike is also rolling out additional \"Live filters\" this festive season that include a Girl Santa, an Elf, a Christmas Tree, Rudolph the Reindeer and Snowman. Hike is also launching a digital campaign called \"Love, Masti, Dosti\". All the features will be available from December 24. --IANS qd/na/bg</p>

item.title: Why are birds toothless? (Lead)
item.description: New York, Dec 23 (IANS) Researchers have discovered a dinosaur species that shed its "milk teeth" but did not replace them, a finding that not only changes its anatomy but also explains why birds have beaks and not teeth.
item.content: New York, Dec 23 (IANS) Researchers have discovered a dinosaur species that shed its "milk teeth" but did not replace them, a finding that not only changes its anatomy but also explains why birds have beaks and not teeth.<p><br><br>Limusaurus inextricabilis is part of the theropod group of dinosaurs, the evolutionary ancestors of birds. <br><br>The study is based on an analysis of 19 Jurassic ceratosaurian theropod Limusaurus inextricabilis skeletons, discovered in "death traps" where they became mired in mud, got stuck and died. <br><br>Their fossils were recovered from Xinjiang in China. <br><br>The skeletons ranged in age from baby to adult, showing the pattern of tooth loss over time. The baby skeleton had small, sharp teeth, and the adult skeletons were consistently toothless.<br><br>"This discovery is important for two reasons," said James Clark, Professor at the George Washington University, US.<br><br>"First, it's very rare to find a growth series from baby to adult dinosaurs. Second, this unusually dramatic change in anatomy suggests there was a big shift in Limusaurus' diet from adolescence to adulthood."<br><br>In addition, these fossils indicate that baby Limusaurus could have been carnivores or omnivores while the adults were herbivores, as they would have needed teeth to chew meat but not plants. <br><br>Chemical makeup in the fossils' bones supports the theory of a change in diet between babies and adults. <br><br>The fossils also could help to show how theropods such as birds lost their teeth, initially through changes during their development from babies to adults, the researchers noted.<br><br>The study was published in the journal Current Biology. <br><br>--IANS<br>rt/in/vt<br></p>

item.title: Science slam through Khasi folklore bags top prize
item.description: Kolkata, Dec 23 (IANS) A young Indian researcher, whose presentation integrated a popular Khasi folk tale with scientific findings to explain the occurrence of a particular parasitic worm in northeast India, has won the top honour in the EURAXESS Science Slam India contest for teaching current science to a diverse audience in an entertaining way.
item.content: Kolkata, Dec 23 (IANS) A young Indian researcher, whose presentation integrated a popular Khasi folk tale with scientific findings to explain the occurrence of a particular parasitic worm in northeast India, has won the top honour in the EURAXESS Science Slam India contest for teaching current science to a diverse audience in an entertaining way.<p><br><br>Science Slam is a science communication format where young scientists explain their research projects in short 10-minute talks to a non-expert audience.<br><br>Damanbha Lyngdoh, a doctoral candidate at North Eastern Hill University-NEHU, Shillong, Meghalaya, impressed judges with his science slam titled "Do not judge a book by its cover - A tale from India's North-East".<br><br>"Damanbha Lyngdoh has won the first prize in India this year in the fourth edition of the Science Slam India. He will be visiting Brussels (headquarters of the European Union) and a research institute of his choice in the EU," the organisers said in a statement.<br><br>The Science Slam offers a platform for young research talent to showcase their work outside of the formal constraints of a research lab or classroom.<br><br>The finalists are judged on the basis of their ability to capture the audience's attention with a precise, accessible and original introduction to their research topic.<br><br>"I presented my slam in story-telling manner along with live performance of playing the Khasi Big Drum or 'Ka Bom' (in Khasi language). The folk tale is adapted to suit the scientific information, and through the folk tale, the scientific knowledge about the diversity of this parasite is elaborated.<br><br>"In addition, the slam highlighted the usefulness of these small and minute parasitic worms (often viewed for their negative aspects), in stabilising the environment and maintaining a balance in mother nature, thereby becoming heroes," Lyngdoh told IANS.<br><br>Already in its fourth installment, the annual science communication competition of the EU-funded EURAXESS Links network has taken place this autumn in Brazil, China and India.<br><br>Winners can also try to get one Marie Sklodowska-Curie fellowship or a European Research Council (ERC) grant, both actions funded by the European Union Research and Innovation Programme Horizon 2020, the organisers said.<br><br>--IANS<br>sgh/sm/dg</p>

item.title: Now book a trip on Baxi with MobiKwik
item.description: Gurugram, Dec 23 (IANS) Domestic mobile wallet platform MobiKwik and on-demand bike taxi company Baxi on Friday announced a tie-up to offer trips to customers using digital transaction.
item.content: Gurugram, Dec 23 (IANS) Domestic mobile wallet platform MobiKwik and on-demand bike taxi company Baxi on Friday announced a tie-up to offer trips to customers using digital transaction.<p><br><br>The partnership allows customers to add cash to their MobiKwik wallet through "Baxi buddies" instead of transferring from bank accounts or credit cards.<br><br>"Our association with Baxi Taxi is another step to serve users after demonetisation of high-value currency notes. Now with MobiKwik, our customers can have a hassle-free bike ride," said Mrinal Sinha, Chief Operating Officer, MobiKwik, in a statement.<br><br>Gurugram-based Baxi is planning to expand to nearly 50 new cities in 2017, thus giving a fillip to MobiKwik's expansion plans, as they can penetrate smaller cities using on this partnership.<br><br>"By partnering with MobiKwik, we hope to bring the cashless economy to many more cities and towns across the country," added Ashutosh Johri, Co-founder, Baxi.<br><br>--IANS<br>qd/na/bg</p>

item.title: ASUS launches ZenWatch 3 in two variants in India (Lead)
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Taiwan-based technology major ASUS on Friday announced "ZenWatch 3" in two strap variants. The leather strap variant is priced at Rs 18,999 and the rubber variant will cost Rs 17,599.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Taiwan-based technology major ASUS on Friday announced "ZenWatch 3" in two strap variants. The leather strap variant is priced at Rs 18,999 and the rubber variant will cost Rs 17,599.<p><br><br>The device is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon Wear 2100 processor and comes with more than 50 software watch faces that can be changed using the "ZenWatch Manager" smartphone app.<br><br>"The powerful �ZenWatch 3' allows the user to manage their lives comfortably. We are sure that the combination of specs and design in this smartwatch will be appreciated by our users," said Peter Chang, Region Head-South Asia and Country Manager, ASUS India.<br><br>ASUS "ZenWatch 3" is a full-featured activity tracker that helps wearers stay motivated and improve their fitness. <br><br>It also features HyperCharge technology that provides industry-leading charge times - just 15 minutes to reach a 60 percent charge - and a magnetic charging connector. <br><br>An optional battery pack is also available, providing 40 percent more battery life.<br><br>Users can pre-order the two varients of ZenWatch 3 (leather in dark brown and rubber in beige colour) on Flipkart from December 23 and a third rubber varient in brownish grey colour will be available from January.<br><br>--IANS<br>vc/na/vm/vt</p>

item.title: Norton by Symantec unveils updated Android mobile security version
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Norton by Symantec on Friday launched a latest version of its flagship mobile solutions "Norton Mobile Security for Android", featuring a "Report Card" that provides automatic security and privacy analysis and reveals where data travels.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Norton by Symantec on Friday launched a latest version of its flagship mobile solutions "Norton Mobile Security for Android", featuring a "Report Card" that provides automatic security and privacy analysis and reveals where data travels.<p><br><br>The latest version, priced at Rs 599 (for one year), includes an enhanced "App Adviser" feature which deploys proactive protections against malicious apps and other sophisticated threats on Android devices.<br><br>"We are seeing a significant uptick in customers installing Norton mobile solutions and believe it is due to people seeking ways to protect their devices which are loaded with sensitive and personal information," said Ritesh Chopra, Country Manager of Norton by Symantec, in a statement.<br><br>Since January 2016, Norton by Symantec has identified more than six lakh new pieces of malware apps and over five lakh new pieces of greyware -- apps with potential privacy issues or intrusive behaviours.<br><br>With the "Report Card" feature, users have a 360-degree view of their mobile device's security and privacy status, helping them take control of and overcome potential mobile threats and privacy risks.<br><br>The feature lets users see where their mobile apps send their photos and other personal data.<br><br>"It also offers an easy-to-understand list of potential privacy vulnerabilities, like past unsecure Wi-Fi connections so users can understand what data might be at risk and course correct," the company said.<br><br>If the device is lost or stolen, "Norton Mobile Security for Android" provides anti-theft capabilities and contacts backup to help users find their device and restore lost information.<br><br>--IANS<br>qd/vt</p>

item.title: GoDaddy helped CompuBrain become top domain name provider
item.description: Ahmedabad, Dec 23 (IANS) Global web-hosting firm GoDaddy on Friday announced that it has helped Ahmedabad-based CompuBrain -- a digital media agency -- to become a top domain name provider for small businesses in the state.
item.content: Ahmedabad, Dec 23 (IANS) Global web-hosting firm GoDaddy on Friday announced that it has helped Ahmedabad-based CompuBrain -- a digital media agency -- to become a top domain name provider for small businesses in the state.<p><br><br>CompuBrain offers a comprehensive suite of products and services including internet reputation management, search engine optimisation (SEO), social media marketing, website design and its flagship service -- domain registration and hosting.<br><br>"GoDaddy has helped us become a one-stop shop for domain name needs and digital services, with over 10,000 domain names registered in the last five years," said Bijoy Patel, Business Head of CompuBrain, in a statement.<br><br>Through GoDaddy, CompuBrain has successfully provided 80 per cent of their customers with ideal domain names for their businesses, the company said.<br><br>US-based GoDaddy offers relevant online products and solutions, including access to integrated web solutions spanning domain registration, email, hosting, website building, marketing tools and aftermarket domain services.<br><br>--IANS<br>vc/na/bg</p>

item.title: 'Golden' smartphone evokes sharp criticism in China
item.description: Beijing, Dec 23 (IANS) A gaudy Forbidden City-themed luxury smartphone that comes with an 18-carat gold dragon decoration and a screen made from sapphire glass has evoked criticism from Chinese social media users.
item.content: Beijing, Dec 23 (IANS) A gaudy Forbidden City-themed luxury smartphone that comes with an 18-carat gold dragon decoration and a screen made from sapphire glass has evoked criticism from Chinese social media users.<p><br><br>According to the Global Times, the "Titanium Palace Edition" smartphone is expected to be released in January and is priced at 19,999 yuan ($2,880).<br><br>Designed in partnership with the Palace Museum, the gem-laden smartphone comes in a limited run of 999 devices.<br><br>"Phone makers '8488' partnered with the Palace Museum to create the limited-edition device inspired by the museum's imperial collections," the report quoted a company post on Sina Weibo platform as saying.<br><br>Sina Weibo users called the phone "ostentatious" and a "stain on the sacredness of the imperial city".<br><br>Responding to criticism, the Palace Museum tried to distance itself from the product or its manufacturing.<br><br>However, earlier this year, Wang Yamin, Vice President of the Palace Museum was quoted by media as saying: "We hope this cooperation will help the Forbidden City enter the tech industry."<br><br>--IANS<br>qd/na/mr</p>

item.title: Uber now at 20 Indian airports, to make travel better
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Online cab-hailing firm Uber on Friday announced that it will focus on improving the airport travel experience for both riders and driver partners in India.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 23 (IANS) Online cab-hailing firm Uber on Friday announced that it will focus on improving the airport travel experience for both riders and driver partners in India.<p><br><br>"Uber is now available at all of the top 20 airports in India and at more than 200 airports globally, with presence at almost all major US and European airports," said Amit Jain, President, Uber, India and South Asia in a statement.<br><br>"Visitors from over 70 countries have used Uber in India while Indian travellers are using their Uber app most frequently in the US, followed by United Kingdom, Singapore, United Arab Emirates and Malaysia," Jain added.<br><br>As part of its "UberSHAAN" initiative, Uber last week urged ex-servicemen in India to avail entrepreneurship opportunities with the company as driver partners.<br><br>Uber has partnered with Ministry of Defence to facilitate interested personnel join the Uber platform as driver entrepreneurs.<br><br>"UBERSHAAN programme is all about empowering these individuals to support their families and provide an opportunity for people to get to know India's veterans better," Uber founder and CEO Travis Kalanick told reporters during his Delhi visit.<br><br>This year, the company launched Uber in two new cities -- Lucknow and Ludhiana -- and expanded "uberPOOL" to four new cities -- Mumbai, Kolkata, Hyderabad and Chennai.<br><br>--IANS<br>vc/na/vm</p>
